alert.note: Alert for Lander (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 20 at 5:32AM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Humboldt River At Battle Mountain affecting Lander County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. For the Lower Humboldt...including Palisade, Battle Mountain, Comus...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...ELevated river levels caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Humboldt River At Battle Mountain. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Minor to moderate lowland flooding throughout the reach. Some rural roads near the river are flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:15 AM PDT Saturday the stage was 9.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above minor flood stage later today and continue rising to 10.0 feet by Tuesday evening. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Action stage is 8.5 feet. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 100 PM PDT.
